keyMoments.title: Caroline's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Caroline appears as the substitute Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom, refusing to give Sanji a boat until Ivankov's ship is spotted approaching the island.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Caroline as the temporary ruler who maintained the kingdom in Ivankov's absence during their imprisonment and participation in the Paramount War.

relationships.description: Caroline served as substitute ruler in Ivankov's absence and returned the position when Ivankov came back.

keyMoments.title: Soran Gives Robin a Portrait
keyMoments.description: Soran, a member of the Revolutionary Army, gives Nico Robin a portrait as a parting gift before they separate at Tequila Wolf.
keyMoments.significance: This anime-only character represents the connection Robin has built with the Revolutionary Army members during her time with them.

relationships.description: Soran befriended Robin during her time with the Revolutionary Army.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Chopper Leaves Torino Kingdom
keyMoments.description: Chopper says goodbye to the villagers and giant birds of Torino Kingdom as he prepares to fly back to Sabaody Archipelago to reunite with Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Chopper's loyalty and determination to help his captain despite the distance and dangers.
keyMoments.quote: I want to get back to Luffy and help him!

keyMoments.title: Chopper Receives the Newspaper
keyMoments.description: While flying on a giant bird, Chopper gets the newspaper from a News Coo and is shocked by the news about Luffy's return to Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Chopper receives Luffy's hidden message about the new meeting plan.

keyMoments.title: Robin Departs Tequila Wolf
keyMoments.description: Robin travels with the Revolutionary Army away from Tequila Wolf, receiving a portrait from Soran as a parting gift.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Robin's journey with the Revolutionary Army after being rescued from enslavement.

keyMoments.title: Robin Understands Luffy's Message
keyMoments.description: Robin reads the newspaper and immediately understands Luffy's hidden message, smiling at the clever plan to communicate with the scattered crew.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Robin's intelligence and her deep understanding of Luffy. Her immediate comprehension shows her analytical abilities.

relationships.description: Robin befriended Revolutionary Army members including Soran during her time with them.

keyMoments.title: Sanji Tries to Leave Kamabakka Kingdom
keyMoments.description: Sanji desperately tries to convince Caroline to give him a boat so he can leave Kamabakka Kingdom and return to his crew.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sanji's desperation to escape the island and reunite with the Straw Hats.

keyMoments.title: Sanji's Wanted Poster Identity Crisis
keyMoments.description: Sanji struggles to prove his identity to Ivankov because of his hilariously bad wanted poster drawing.
keyMoments.significance: The running gag of Sanji's poorly-drawn wanted poster becomes a genuine obstacle.

keyMoments.title: Sanji Battles Ivankov
keyMoments.description: Sanji fights Ivankov to prove he is part of Luffy's crew and worthy of information.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the power gap between Sanji and a Revolutionary Army commander.

keyMoments.title: Sanji Receives the Newspaper
keyMoments.description: After being defeated by Ivankov, Sanji receives the newspaper and reads about Luffy's shocking return to Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Sanji receives Luffy's hidden message about the new meeting plan.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Hijacks Marine Battleship
keyMoments.description: Luffy, along with Rayleigh and Jinbe, captures a Marine battleship and forces them to open the Gates of Justice to return to Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Beginning of Luffy's secret mission to deliver a message to his scattered crew members.

name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Helps Luffy Return to Marineford
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh assists Luffy and Jinbe in hijacking a Marine battleship to return to Marineford for a secret mission.
keyMoments.significance: Rayleigh's role as Luffy's mentor extends to helping him communicate with his scattered crew.

keyMoments.title: Jinbe Helps Luffy Return to Marineford
keyMoments.description: Jinbe assists Luffy and Rayleigh in hijacking a Marine battleship to return to Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Jinbe's continued support for Luffy after the events of Marineford.

name.japanese: エンポリオ・イワンコフ

keyMoments.title: Ivankov Returns to Kamabakka Kingdom
keyMoments.description: Ivankov returns to Kamabakka Kingdom after escaping Impel Down and surviving the Paramount War, reuniting with their subjects.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Ivankov's return to their homeland and resumption of their role as Queen.

keyMoments.title: Ivankov Tests Sanji
keyMoments.description: Ivankov battles Sanji to verify his claim of being a Straw Hat crew member.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Ivankov's power as a Revolutionary Army commander.

keyMoments.title: Ivankov Receives Call from Dragon
keyMoments.description: Ivankov receives a Den Den Mushi call from Dragon at Baltigo to discuss Luffy's actions and the Revolutionary Army's response to Whitebeard's death.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Ivankov's role in the Revolutionary Army's leadership structure.

relationships.description: Ivankov serves as a commander in Dragon's Revolutionary Army.

name.japanese: モンキー・D・ドラゴン

keyMoments.title: Dragon Calls from Baltigo
keyMoments.description: Dragon contacts Ivankov from Revolutionary Army headquarters to discuss Luffy's actions and the changing world situation.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Dragon's awareness of his son's actions and his strategic thinking as Revolutionary Army leader.

keyMoments.title: Dragon Decides to Gather Commanders
keyMoments.description: Dragon decides to gather all Revolutionary Army commanders in response to Whitebeard's death and the coming upheaval.
keyMoments.significance: Foreshadows major Revolutionary Army operations and the changing world order.

relationships.description: Dragon is Luffy's father, though they have had little direct interaction.

keyMoments.title: Inazuma Informs Ivankov of Dragon's Call
keyMoments.description: Inazuma tells Ivankov that Dragon is calling from Baltigo via Den Den Mushi.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Inazuma's role as deputy commander and liaison.
